intro: Leptoderris pynaertii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
